summary: This is a law enforcement report generated on August 14, 2019, containing records from internet posts on August 10, 2019, related to the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The report includes an anonymous post from the /pol/ board alleging suspicious circumstances around Epstein's death, including an unrecorded vehicle and a possible switch.

persons.name: Anonymous
persons.context: Posts an anonymous comment on the /pol/ board describing suspicious events at the jail on the night of Jeffrey Epstein's death, including an unrecorded trip van and a person in military attire.

events.title: Anonymous post about Epstein's death circumstances
events.description: An anonymous post on the /pol/ board alleges that after the 0415 count, Jeffrey Epstein was taken to medical in a wheelchair, an unrecorded trip van arrived, and he was later found dead in a single-man cell. The poster suggests a possible switch.

events.title: Deletion of post 30169564
events.description: A deletion record shows post number 30169564 was cleared on August 10, 2019, at 09:46:22 EDT.

keyFacts: An anonymous post alleges suspicious circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death, including an unrecorded 'trip van' that did not sign in and whose plate number was not recorded.
The post claims a person in a 'green dress military outfit' was in the back of the van, according to a tower guard.
The poster suggests Epstein may have been 'switched out' and did not actually hang himself in his cell.
The report was generated from records provided pursuant to a subpoena, indicating it was part of an official investigation.
The post states that releases do not occur on weekends unless ordered by a judge, implying the van's arrival was irregular.
